raw_comment: I notice that most countries surveyed tend to have more 15-25 year olds that say the world is improving and less 40  year olds. I do notice however that primarily Indonesia has high percentages for both categories. I wonder why people specifically in Indonesia are very optimistic about the future. This relates to me because it shows what percentage of people don’t support my generation and what percentage does. When there are big percentage differences that can cause conflict in my life with others who share different views. A catchy headline could be “Older Generations Have Little Faith for the New Generation”.
ace_sentences: In most surveyed countries, many 15-25 year olds say that the world is improving.
In most surveyed countries, few 40-year olds say that the world is improving.
In Indonesia, many 15-25 year olds say that the world is improving.
In Indonesia, many 40-year olds say that the world is improving.
I wonder why people in Indonesia are optimistic about the future.
This information shows what percentage of people support my generation.
This information also shows what percentage of people do not support my generation.
Big percentage differences can cause conflict in my life.
This conflict can happen with other people who have different views.
The headline is: Older generations have little faith for the new generation.
